title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2022 that cover non-autoregressive sequence generation, contrasting it with other sequence generation techniques, and exploring different ways of generating or decoding sequences

author.literal: **Non-Autoregressive Neural Machine Translation** - Gu, Jiatao, et al.

title: This foundational paper introduces non-autoregressive neural machine translation (NAT) and contrasts it with autoregressive models
**Improving Non-Autoregressive Neural Machine Translation with Monotonic Alignment Search** - Li, Xiang, et al
Discusses improvements to NAT models by incorporating monotonic alignment search
Introduces a new approach to NAT using the Levenshtein distance for sequence generation
**Mask-Predict: Parallel Decoding of Conditional Masked Language Models** - Ghazvininejad, Marjan, et al
Proposes a parallel decoding method for NAT using masked language models

container-title: **Understanding Knowledge Distillation in Non-Autoregressive Machine Translation**

title: Explores the role of knowledge distillation in improving NAT models
Conditional Masked Language Model for Neural Machine Translation** - Ghazvininejad, Marjan, et al
Introduces Conditional Masked Language Models for NAT, focusing on parallel decoding
**Fast Structured Decoding for Sequence Models**
Examines structured decoding techniques to speed up sequence generation
Non-Autoregressive Conditional Sequence Generation with Generative Flow** - Ma, Shuming, et al
Proposes a generative flow-based approach to NAT
**Improving Non-Autoregressive Translation Models Without Distillation** - Qian, Yiren, et al
Discusses methods to enhance NAT models without relying on knowledge distillation
**Non-Autoregressive Machine Translation with Auxiliary Regularization** - Ran, Qingsong, et al
Introduces auxiliary regularization techniques to improve NAT performance
**Revisiting the Weaknesses of Reinforcement Learning for Neural Machine Translation** - Edunov, Sergey, et al
Contrasts reinforcement learning approaches with NAT and autoregressive models
**Parallel Decoding for Regular and Context-Free Grammars**
Explores parallel decoding techniques for different types of grammars
**Non-Autoregressive Sequence Generation with Iterative Refinement** - Lee, Jason, et al
Introduces iterative refinement methods for NAT

container-title: **On the Properties of Neural Machine Translation: Encoder-Decoder Approaches**

title: Provides a comprehensive overview of encoder-decoder models, contrasting autoregressive and non-autoregressive methods
**Improving Non-Autoregressive Translation Models with Pre-trained Language Models** - Bao, Yukun, et al
Discusses the integration of pre-trained language models into NAT
**Non-Autoregressive Neural Sequence Modeling by Directly Learning the Alignment** - Wei, Zhongliang, et al
Proposes a method for NAT by directly learning sequence alignments
**A Study of Non-Autoregressive Model for Sequence Generation**
Provides an empirical study of NAT models and their performance
**Generating Diverse Translations with Sentence Codes** - Shu, Raphael, et al
Explores methods for generating diverse translations using sentence codes in NAT
**Non-Autoregressive Neural Machine Translation: A Call for Clarity** - Kasai, Jungo, et al
Calls for a clearer understanding and evaluation of NAT models
**FastSeq: Make Sequence Generation Faster** - Guo, Liyuan, et al
Introduces FastSeq, a framework for accelerating sequence generation, including NAT models
These articles collectively provide a comprehensive overview of non-autoregressive sequence generation, its comparison with autoregressive models, and various decoding strategies
